problem_text: Machine Learning algorithms can be categorized as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning. Unsupervised learning doesn't require labelled data. The state-of-the-art text summarization model is trained with machine learning algorithms. Reinforcement learning is not used to train the state-of-the-art text summarization model. The Machine Learning algorithm for training text summarization model requires labelled data.
predicates:
CategorizedAs(x, y) ::: Machine Learning algorithm x is categorized as y.
SupervisedLearning(x) ::: x is supervised learning.
UnsupervisedLearning(x) ::: x is unsupervised learning.
ReinforcementLearning(x) ::: x is reinforcement learning.
Requires(x, y) ::: x requires y.
LabeledData(x) ::: x is labelled data.
StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel(x) ::: x is the state-of-the-art text summarization model.
TrainedWith(x, y) ::: x is trained with y.
MachineLearningAlgorithm(x) ::: x is a Machine Learning algorithm.
UsedToTrain(x, y) ::: x is used to train y.
TextSummarizationModel(x) ::: x is a text summarization model.

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? The state-of-the-art text summarization model is a supervised learning algorithm.
tests.conclusions: SupervisedLearning(stateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel) ::: The state-of-the-art text summarization model is a supervised learning algorithm. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Any machine learning algorithm that requires labelled data is a supervised learning algorithm.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? The state-of-the-art text summarization model is trained with a machine learning algorithm that requires labelled data.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? The state-of-the-art text summarization model is trained with a machine learning algorithm that is not unsupervised learning.
tests.conclusions: ¬∃x (StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel(x) ∧ TrainedWith(x, y) ∧ UnsupervisedLearning(y)) ::: The state-of-the-art text summarization model is trained with a machine learning algorithm that is not unsupervised learning. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? The state-of-the-art text summarization model is trained with a machine learning algorithm that is supervised learning.
tests.conclusions: SupervisedLearning(x) ∧ TrainedWith(stateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel, x) ::: The state-of-the-art text summarization model is trained with a machine learning algorithm that is supervised learning. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Any machine learning algorithm that is supervised learning requires labelled data.
tests.conclusions: ∀x (SupervisedLearning(x) → Requires(x, LabeledData)) ::: Any machine learning algorithm that is supervised learning requires labelled data. TRUE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? The state-of-the-art text summarization model is trained with a machine learning algorithm that is not reinforcement learning.
tests.conclusions: StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel(x) ∧ TrainedWith(x, y) ∧ MachineLearningAlgorithm(y) ∧ ¬ReinforcementLearning(y) ::: The state-of-the-art text summarization model is trained with a machine learning algorithm that is not reinforcement learning. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Any unsupervised learning algorithm is not used to train the state-of-the-art text summarization model.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Any machine learning algorithm that is supervised learning is trained with labelled data.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Any machine learning algorithm used to train the state-of-the-art text summarization model is supervised learning.

candidate_solutions.text:
# Predicates:
CategorizedAs(x, y) ::: Machine Learning algorithm x is categorized as y.
SupervisedLearning(x) ::: x is supervised learning.
UnsupervisedLearning(x) ::: x is unsupervised learning.
ReinforcementLearning(x) ::: x is reinforcement learning.
Requires(x, y) ::: x requires y.
LabeledData(x) ::: x is labelled data.
StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel(x) ::: x is the state-of-the-art text summarization model.
TrainedWith(x, y) ::: x is trained with y.
MachineLearningAlgorithm(x) ::: x is a Machine Learning algorithm.
UsedToTrain(x, y) ::: x is used to train y.
TextSummarizationModel(x) ::: x is a text summarization model.

# Premises:
∀x (MachineLearningAlgorithm(x) → (CategorizedAs(x, supervised) ∨ CategorizedAs(x, unsupervised) ∨ CategorizedAs(x, reinforcement))) ::: Machine Learning algorithms can be categorized as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning.
∀x (UnsupervisedLearning(x) → ¬Requires(x, LabeledData)) ::: Unsupervised learning doesn't require labelled data.
∀x (StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel(x) → ∃y (MachineLearningAlgorithm(y) ∧ TrainedWith(x, y))) ::: The state-of-the-art text summarization model is trained with machine learning algorithms.
∀x (ReinforcementLearning(x) → ¬UsedToTrain(x, StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel)) ::: Reinforcement learning is not used to train the state-of-the-art text summarization model.
∃x (MachineLearningAlgorithm(x) ∧ TrainedWith(StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel, x) ∧ Requires(x, LabeledData)) ::: The Machine Learning algorithm for training text summarization model requires labelled data.

# Predicates:
CategorizedAs(x, y) ::: Machine Learning algorithm x is categorized as y.

ReinforcementLearning(x) ::: x is reinforcement learning.

MachineLearningAlgorithm(x) ::: x is a Machine Learning algorithm.
UsedToTrain(x, y) ::: x is used to train y.
TextSummarizationModel(x) ::: x is a text summarization model.

# Premises:
∀x (MachineLearningAlgorithm(x) → (SupervisedLearning(x) ∨ UnsupervisedLearning(x) ∨ ReinforcementLearning(x))) ::: Machine Learning algorithms can be categorized as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning.
∀x (UnsupervisedLearning(x) → ¬Requires(x, LabeledData)) ::: Unsupervised learning doesn't require labelled data.
∃y (MachineLearningAlgorithm(y) ∧ TrainedWith(StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel, y)) ::: The state-of-the-art text summarization model is trained with machine learning algorithms.
∀x (ReinforcementLearning(x) → ¬UsedToTrain(x, StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel)) ::: Reinforcement learning is not used to train the state-of-the-art text summarization model.
∃x (MachineLearningAlgorithm(x) ∧ TrainedWith(StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel, x) ∧ Requires(x, LabeledData)) ::: The Machine Learning algorithm for training text summarization model requires labelled data.

validation.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true, false, or uncertain? Supervised learning is used to train the state-of-the-art text summarization model.
validation.conclusions: SupervisedLearning(x) ∧ UsedToTrain(x, StateOfTheArtTextSummarizationModel(y)) ::: Supervised learning is used to train the state-of-the-art text summarization model. true
